title: Calories in Mashed Potatoes
meta_description: Discover calories in mashed potatoes per cup serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Standard recipe with peeled potatoes, butter, and whole milk; about 210 g per cup; no added salt or gravy.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, potato type, milk/fat content, and portion size. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One cup of mashed potatoes provides about 237 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Made without butter (use low-fat milk only)
Add 1 tbsp sour cream per cup
Use skin-on potatoes for extra fiber

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Approximately 237 kcal for a standard butter and milk recipe.

faqs.q: Are mashed potatoes high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 36 g carbs per cup, mainly from potatoes.

faqs.q: How much protein in mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Roughly 4 g protein per cup, a modest amount.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Yes, skip butter or use skim milk to cut ~80 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in mashed potatoes?
faqs.a: Around 486 mg per cup if salt is added; varies by recipe.
